attributes.action: MPs giving wishing to give back expenses should give the money to Derain House rather than fees office
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Charity, Derian House Childrens Hospice for terminally ill.

The Derian House Charity has raised £1.7 million to build a new facility in the grounds for teenagers. This building is now complete.

The Government are now demanding £350,000 VAT as they're classing the building as an extension to the main building and because of this VAT is due.

The original building did not attract VAT as it's a "Charity" facility.

Rules on VAT don't have any flexibility for what is morally wrong!!! May be the MPs who have been morally wrong to abuse the expenses system can do something for a Charity that support terminally ill children to demonstrate they do know the difference between what is right and wrong!!!!!

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
